titles.title: Providing for consideration of motions to suspend the rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-322, by Mrs. Myrick.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 104.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 305.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 207 - 179 (Roll no. 476).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 12/5/2001--Reported to House without amendment. Makes it in order at any time on December 6, 2001, for the Speaker of the House of Representatives to entertain motions that the House suspend the rules relating to the following measures: (1) H.R. 3008 (trade adjustment assistance program reauthorization); and (2) H.R. 3129 (U.S. Customs Service and related agencies appropriations for FY 2002 through 2003).
